I’m a PhD student within both the Optimisation and Machine Learning for Process Systems Engineering Group (OptiML PSE) and Optimisation Methods for Green Applications (OMEGA) groups within the Sargent Centre at Imperial College London.

I research Probabilistic Machine Learning for Decision Making under Uncertainty, where I develop new algorithms and methods for modelling and controlling Process Systems. This involves interesting inductive biases into Machine Learning models to ensure feasibility with known underlying phenomena.

I generally like the application of mathematical and ML modelling and methods to real world problems such as sports, finance, and more. I write about some of the side projects I do here, and also food I have eaten and if I think it’s any good.
